alert.note: Alert for Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 3:16AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Zapata County through 345 AM CDT... At 315 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Fort Ewell Site to 11 miles east of Ranchitos Las Lomas to 11 miles southwest of Laredo Community College. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Ygnacio. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 738 and 752. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
